decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emperor of Bones, then using instant spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to bring them back onto the battlefield for a game-winning combo. The deck also includes a variety of utility creatures and spells to control the game and protect the combo pieces. The key strategy is to reanimate high-impact creatures at instant speed to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones, using cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour. Once you have creatures in your graveyard, you can then use spells like Unearth and Persist to bring them back onto the battlefield for a powerful combo finish. Additionally, disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Spell Pierce help to protect your combo pieces and control the game. The deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with big creatures and efficient reanimation spells.

The focal point of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor, and eventually search for and play Primeval Titan to fetch lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Vesuva. The goal is to assemble the right pieces to combo off and win the game by either overwhelming the opponent with Primeval Titan's powerful abilities or using Scapeshift to deal massive amounts of damage. This deck aims to establish a dominant board presence and quickly close out games through its powerful ramp and combo potential.

This deck focuses on generating massive amounts of mana through Eldrazi Temple and Urza's Saga to quickly ramp into big threats like Emrakul, the Promised End. The combo aspect comes from using Writhing Chrysalis to tutor for powerful Eldrazi creatures, while also benefiting from Blade of the Bloodchief to buff up your creatures. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with powerful threats and disrupt their game plan with cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble. The deck utilizes a mixture of creature ramp and control elements to dominate the game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the opponent's moves through various counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. By controlling the game tempo and disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Spell Snare, this deck aims to establish dominance and outmaneuver the opponent. The inclusion of graveyard interaction cards like Cling to Dust and Unearth adds an extra layer of strategy to the deck, while the creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and Psychic Frog provide additional control options. The deck also includes a strong mana base to support its control-heavy gameplay.

This deck revolves around the strategy of instantly bringing powerful creatures back from the graveyard to the battlefield, creating unexpected interactions and combos. It combines cards that enable instant reanimation with disruptive spells to control the game until the combo is ready. The presence of cards like Griselbrand and Ephemerate allows for strong plays and card advantage. The deck also includes efficient removal and counterspells to handle threats and protect the combo pieces. Overall, it aims to surprise opponents with quick and powerful plays while maintaining control of the game.

The focus of the deck is to quickly generate mana with cards like Ruby Medallion and rituals, cast spells for free or discounted costs, and chain together a series of spells to either win the game with a large Grapeshot or Past in Flames loop. Ral, Monsoon Mage is used to filter through the deck and find combo pieces, while Wish allows for additional flexibility and toolbox options. The deck is designed to be explosive and fast-paced, aiming to win the game before the opponent can establish a strong board presence.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Tune the Narrative, the deck aims to lock down the board while slowly building up card advantage. With a focus on control and resilience, the deck seeks to outlast the opponent and take control of the game with powerful finishers like Quantum Riddler and Wrath of the Skies.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up your mana to overwhelm your opponent with high-power creatures like Scion of Draco and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer helps with early aggression while Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding provide protection and control. Tribal Flames can finish off your opponent if needed, while Lightning Bolt provides removal. The deck also includes some counter spells for defense and card draw to maintain momentum. Arena of Glory can give your creatures an extra boost, making them even more threatening.

The key concept of this deck is to win through a landless combo strategy, utilizing powerful creatures and artifacts to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By combining cards like Tameshi, Reality Architect and Goblin Charbelcher with disruptive spells such as Disrupting Shoal and Whir of Invention, the deck aims to quickly assemble a winning combination and close out the game. Additionally, cards like Suppression Field and Waterlogged Teachings provide extra utility and protection against opposing strategies.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of discard spells like Thoughtseize and card draw like Sign in Blood. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells such as Fatal Push and Fell the Profane, while also utilizing powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Soul Spike. The deck also includes synergies with cards like Boggart Trawler and Orcish Bowmasters to maintain card advantage and outvalue the opponent. The overall strategy is to grind out the opponent and secure victory through attrition and powerful threats.

This deck focuses on using graveyard manipulation and card draw to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures, then reanimating them onto the battlefield for a game-winning combo. The key strategy is to use cards like Unearth and Persist to bring back high-impact creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones as quickly as possible. Thought Scour and Faithless Looting help fill the graveyard while also providing card advantage. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to help protect the combo. With efficient card draw and reanimation, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures.

The primary focus of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. Utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures and colorless spells, the deck aims to control the game by removing threats with cards like Dismember and Kozilek's Command, while also using Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms to dominate the battlefield. The deck's main strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and powerful control elements enabled by the UrzaTron lands.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to maintain control of the game through countering spells, removing threats, and manipulating the opponent's deck. Using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Counterspell to stop the opponent's plays, and cards like Stock Up and Tune the Narrative to draw cards and filter the deck. The deck also includes removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Wrath of the Skies to deal with threats on the board. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to control the game and outmaneuver the opponent with powerful control spells.

The deck focuses on using control spells and card advantage to dominate the game. With powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils, along with counterspells like Counterspell and Force of Negation, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value through draw spells and removal. The mana base is optimized to support a variety of spells and provide flexibility in casting different colors of spells. Ultimately, the goal is to outvalue the opponent and control the game until the win condition can be established.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan by countering their spells, removing their threats, and generating card advantage through cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Ephemerate. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win through attrition, using cards like Stock Up, Tune the Narrative, and Quantum Riddler to maintain resources and eventually win the game with powerful finishers like Wrath of the Skies and Solitude.
